name: Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong

reviews.text: A hotel is normally a physical place that has clean and sometimes quiet rooms, all of which is facilitated by a staff of pleasant personnel that generally manage your stay as one of a number of other guests......Then there is the Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong, that is neither a mere building, with merely adequate accommodations or just pleasant staff! The MOHK is a Zen experience that goes beyond perfect as the staff not only anticipate your needs, they do it with such precise logic and skill that you would think they are part of your own thought process.
reviews.title: It goes beyond PERFECT

reviews.text: Let's start with the rooms, spacious, but so well thought out that everything is where you would expect it to be, like a shower room that is....only for your bathing needs, and the little heat behind the mirror that keeps a large section available to you while steam coats all the other surfaces in the "room". And whoever thought out the luggage space is obviously one who travels. Imagine having a marble counter that actually accommodates a 29" three suitor AND a smaller 20" suitcase on the same shelf, and I mean both of these being open at the same time! So if you are at MOHK for three days or three weeks, your cases will magically fit in to your room and not take up any of your other space needs. But that's not all, as we also had a small bag of shoes, that we needed to lay on the floor, until we stepped out of the room for dinner and came back where our shoe bag rested comfortably on its own luggage rack, how does that happen?
reviews.title: One of the best hotels in the world

reviews.text: Being somewhat obsessive, I like to rearrange my room to fit my own needs, like the technical and digital devices own needs today and especially my toiletries which I like to organize by use and function.
reviews.title: Mandarin Oriental Hong Kong is always to be my first choose

reviews.text: Little did I know that on the second day of our stay, we returned to the room to find all of my digital "stuff" was organized not just as if to be "put away". it was organized with such logical precision that whenever I expected to pick something up or put it down, it was already done, that's a it scary when housekeeping is out thinking you.
reviews.title: How to eat and sleep well in Hong Kong

reviews.text: I could go on forever, but one last thing that just blew us away! Besides knowing which side of the bed to put the most comfortable black (male) or red (female) slippers on, when my wife left her earrings on the bedside table, they disappeared into a velvet box so that they were so much easier to find and it felt as if she had received a gift of a new pair of earrings from me! Housekeeping in any other hotel just does not do those things.
reviews.title: The best hotel in Asia

reviews.text: I've stayed here a dozen times on business in the last few years. Can't recommend it highly enough.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel - excellent in every way

reviews.text: This is a fantastic hotel: rooms, service and ambience are fabulous. You really feel like you are staying somewhere special.
reviews.title: One of the greats

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have had a fantastic time in this Hotel and they made our stay very special
reviews.title: 30th Wedding Anniversary

reviews.text: I stayed at the MOHK in May 2010 for 3 nights for business. The rooms are recently remodeled and are some of the most luxurious in which I've stayed for work or pleasure. The common areas are exceptionally well-maintained. I used the gym and business center several times, and both were efficient and extensive. I also visited the spa once, and had the best massage of my life. However, as many others have noted, while the physical spaces are beautiful, the service at the MOHK is really what sets it apart. The service is discreet, intuitive and gracious. I have stayed at other MO's (like San Francisco, Boston and London) and thought their service was superior, but MOHK blows them (and other similar hotels) away. I can not imagine staying elsewhere in HK.
reviews.title: Truly Outstanding Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 night stay here, and highly recommend it.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

reviews.text: From the outside this hotel is not special but inside it lives up to its expectations. It is elegant and oozes class and great service. The rooms are extremely comfortable and well equipped with gorgeous bathrooms.
reviews.title: One of the world's great hotels
Concierge is lousy...
reviews.text: Avoid the rooms on the lower floors if you want the true experience as a view is a must in a city like Hog Kong.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location couldn't be better.
reviews.title: Tranquility in a crazy city

reviews.text: The hotel has great location, rooms are okay, but what annoys me is the concierge. We tried to get more information about where to head, but the Chief Conciege (not kidding you) was unable to point us to anything more than guide books materials. I would have expected something more, after paying so much for a tier one hotel. I mean, guide books cost way less than the hotel room/service - we don't need a concierge that points us to those information..
reviews.title: good location, good service

reviews.text: The last time I stayed in Hong Kong was 1996 and I stayed in a hotel in Kowloon well away from the action. This time we stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in a harbour view room on HK Island. We booked through Kuoni and we were collected from the airport in a limo and dropped at the hotel where our Kuoni guide was waiting to greet us, help with check-in and provide details of the city for our short 3 day stay - could not fault them.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: Following its multi million-dollar refurbishment the Mandarin Oriental is a true jewel in Hong Kong’s list of great hotels. Our room (a 'Premier Room' on their website) was totally gorgeous. Hotel staff were great and the facilities first class.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay

reviews.text: All good businesses aim to “surprise and delight” their customers and on that basis the hotel scored 10/10 when we were met from our limo transfer from the airport by staff who knew our name and escorted us straight to our room to complete check in formalities. Excellent.
reviews.title: Back to form

reviews.text: FOOD
reviews.title: Much nicer now its been renovated

likes.disliked: — That reception clearly are trying NOT to impress guests with their room allocation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast in the Clipper Lounge overlooking the lobby was fantastic. There is also a buffet lunch and dinner there which looked wonderful. The other restaurants require an expense account to fully enjoy them.
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.text: BAR
reviews.title: Full marks to the MO

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the MO for five nights on a combination of business and pleasure, and it really was super.
reviews.title: Luxe to the Max

likes.liked: — best urban spa I've tried yet
likes.disliked: — rooms arn't huge, but this is Central Hong Kong

reviews.title: The Best
reviews.text: I concur with an earlier post that the new decor is rather masculine, but it works. I would add that the design of the room I stayed in was very effective. The room featured an alcove with a desk and a reading nook at the far end, enjoying a view of Exchange Square below. It's great for dining, as they can just roll the cart in and turn around the desk chair. You can pull also the curtains on the alcove, which allowed to me work late at night while my daughter was sleeping. We had two rooms in our party and did have a couple of plumbing issues (leaky minibar etc), but they were quickly resolved.
As is so often the case with MO properties, the service was stellar. The concierge desk, in particular, was extremely helpful setting up excellent babysitting and Mandarin lessons for my child.
reviews.title: New Year at the Mandarin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa/fitness is vast, and the ladies area features a quirky pool with stones you walk on to create a refloxology experience.
reviews.title: Totally amazing

reviews.text: Having stayed at the Peninsula before, I was eager to experience either the Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons, or Mandarin Oriental. Having stayed at the W, which is located in the same development as the Ritz and not caring for its particular location in Kowloon, I eliminated it first and then chose the Mandarin over the Four Seasons based on the design language of the rooms. At least for me, it was a choice well-made and I do prefer the Mandarin over the Peninsula.
reviews.title: A Faultless and Endearing Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Mandarin is so well and richly conceived that it reaches deeply into you and offers a treasured and memorable experience. From the moment you arrive, you are made to feel special, valued, and appreciated. More importantly for me, the quality and materials in the rooms are beyond reproach in quality, touch, texture, and maintenance. From the Hermes toiletries to the Denon audio to the lavender mist for the pillows, all details are artfully executed.
reviews.title: First Class Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spa, gym, and pool are all top-drawer and as a recent reviewer also noted, the Chinese Herbal steamroom provides a unique and amazing place for relaxation.
reviews.title: Quiet Elegance and Spectacular!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While Hong Kong has almost limitless dining options, I must give the hotel high marks on the depth and breadth of options it alone contains. My personal preference is to minimize the amount of daylight hours spent sitting in restaurants, so I found the Mandarin Cake Shop especially appealing for quick breakfast and lunch fixes that can be taken at their bar or as take-away, offering the speed of fast food and the luxury of the Mandarin all in one.
reviews.title: Brilliant!

reviews.text: Lastly, I appreciated the hushed quiet I found in the 20th floor room facing the Legislative Council Building and offering both island and harbour views. I'd expected a bit of noise being located in Central, but found both interior and exterior noise volumes quite minimal and the high speed of the room fan a very effective buffer.
reviews.title: The Good, The Better, and The Beautiful

reviews.text: Fantastic hotel in the heart of Hong Kong. Every detail is designed for excellence and the staff is impeccable and very professional, very attentive and never intrusive.
reviews.title: Perfection!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The elegant room, with a view of the skyscrapers of the city was endowed with every comfort (iPod, stereo, TV, DVD ,...).
reviews.title: wonderful hotel

reviews.text: The large bathroom with separate shower and bathtub, has a corner with the sink and its radio and television.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent restaurants with Western and Asian cuisine and beautiful SPA.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Hong Kong

reviews.text: We definitely will return, Hong Kong has a special charm!
reviews.title: life time experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: MOHK is the original and the best hotel of the Mandarin Oriental Group. After staying in many of the Group's properties, we finally found an excuse to make a getaway to HK and stay in the original.
reviews.title: The Original and Best: Elegance Defined

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel exudes elegance and has managed to maintain the ambiance and atmosphere of the hotel that first opened in the early 1960's. A very extensive renovation has resulted in a completely modern hotel, but with original elegance of Hong Kong's first luxury hotel remaining.
reviews.title: Truly five star

reviews.text: The lobby is fully staffed by a well trained bell staff that jump at the opportunity to assist guests. After confirming guest identify, the majority of the check in ritual is performed by the front desk staff in the comfort of the guest's room. Bags arrive in the room within minutes of arrival.
reviews.title: 100+ years of perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms, and the entire hotel, is tastefully appointed with Chinese themes, as is expected at a Mandarin Oriental. Rooms are equipped with flat panel TVs and stereo sets for music.
reviews.title: An outstanding Hotel!

reviews.text: The bathing room has both a deep hot tub style bath, hand held shower wand, and pulse shower heads. Bath amenities are provided by Hermes.
reviews.title: Excellent Service, reminiscent of the days when people would dress up for dinner.

reviews.text: I had been to this property before, but had never stayed there. We loved our Oriental Suite. It was such an inventive use of space. Although it is only 700 sq. ft. or so, it is divided into about five different areas: bedroom, living room, bathroom, dressing area and entry hall. Instead of feeling poky, as is possible, it felt incredibly clever and private. Our large bathroom was wonderful, with two huge sink areas and a large shower with Acqua di Parma products. Every room has an Nespresso, which was a great help with jet lag. Service was great.
reviews.title: Love the Oriental Suite and FABULOUS breakfast

reviews.text: A special feature of this hotel is the wonderful breakfast buffet. Try it. You will not be disappointed. It's the first place that I ever had whole wheat steamed buns...and they were memorable. Also, try the air yogurt. I'm not usually a yogurt fan, but this was a light take on yogurt, with wonderful fruit. I couldn't get enough. The rest of the pastries were top notch. All breakfast items were incredible. I don't know of a better breakfast than this in the world.
reviews.title: The perfect hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One small niggle...we stayed here on American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts rate. We were supposed to be upgraded if possible. Our first Oriental Suite was situated towards the back of the hotel, with no view to speak of. Very nice, but a little dark. When I inquired about a better view, they did give me the Deluxe Oriental Suite on a higher floor at no charge, with view of the harbor...but I was entitled to this anyway under the terms of the Amex rate. So I don't think I should have had to ask for a better view, when this upgrade was clearly available. It should nave been given automatically. I hope the MO will pay attention to the Amex rate and the benefits associated with that.
reviews.title: Always good, but this time was better

reviews.text: But other than that, the stay was brilliant, and don't miss breakfast. You will regret it!
reviews.title: Best of the best

reviews.text: Decided to return to the Mandarin for my 5th stay here - and once again it was perfection.
reviews.title: 2nd stay just as good as the 1st

reviews.text: Returning to HKG after 15 years, I didn't bother to check out other hotels, as I remember the MO to be best in the 90s. The Hotel Airport Limo service, where you get spectacular views en route, made the transit seemless. We had booked a suite at HKD 7000 per night, and although it was on the 22nd floor with fantastic views, it was smaller than we had expected. None-the-less, the hotel boasted a complete renovation, which was apparent from the state-of-the-art amenities (including one TV in the bathroom), DVD & CD player, Wi-Fi connection through to one of the most comfortable king beds we have slept in. But no fruit basket on our arrival!
reviews.title: MO adds to awesome HKG

reviews.text: The location is hard to beat, a short walk to shopping malls and some of the finest restaurants in the world. All-in-all, the MO is at the higher end of the luxury scale, where everything works or is sorted within minutes.
reviews.title: Mandarin Oriental

reviews.text: I stayed at the MO Hong Kong for 6 days this month. If it's a hassle free arrival and transfer you require after a long flight then I'd recommend the limo transfer. Pre-book with concierge as they get booked up quickly - a porter meets you in the arrivals hall, takes care of your luggage, ushers you directly to the limo and within 30-40 mins (traffic dependant) you're in your room, checked in. Upon arrival I was offered an upgrade to the Oriental Suite with panoramic views of Victoria harbour and Statue Square - a superb room. The level of service was impeccable, the food (both restaurants and room service) was very good (the best room service breakfast i've ever had), the bars lively, the spa did great massages and the gym, albeit on the small side, was equipped with the very latest cardio machines and free weights section. Ideally located in Central, 10 mins walk to SOHO and 5 mins walk to the star ferry terminal. An oasis of calm nestled in central HK. I'd recommend the MO Hong Kong to anyone!
reviews.title: Pretty Good

reviews.text: I stayed here for a business trip for two days. Its a pretty nice hotel, the spa is great and the gym is also nice. Located in a convenient location.
reviews.title: Classy, consistent, and a pleasure

reviews.text: Went to HK for business and stayed in the old wing of the Mandarin for one night.
reviews.title: You'll feel like royalty

likes.disliked: — Nothing. PS in rainy season don't pay extra for the view - you won't see much of the harbour

reviews.text: Couldn't have asked for anything more for a business stay. Every aspect of the stay was fantastic, but for me the service was exceptional. The location makes it an easy choice for anyone travelling to Hong Kong on business.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: There are a few great hotels in the world and the Mandarin Oriental chain has a few of them. Their property in Hong Kong is extraordinary in the elegant accommodations they provide, the level of service at every level, and the overall experience of being taken care of while you are staying there. it was truly one of the more memorable hotel experiences.
reviews.title: Elegance away from home

reviews.text: A home away from home. Service some of the best I have received globally. The Mandarin Grill and Bar restaurant unbelievable innovative and the sommelier knowledgeable. Room spacious, harbour views amazing, modern facilities, check in/out without delay. If thinking about spending the a little extra for the experience, you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Consider nowhere else

reviews.text: Excellent service with great attention to detail. Their turndown service is one of the best in the world with something different every night and very discreet. I wish they had a choice of different pillows though as I found the pillows too small and soft.
reviews.title: Excellent service
Setting the Standard in Hong Kong
reviews.text: Great location and the design of the rooms are well thought through. The walls are a little thin though and you can hear your neighbours wake up/ shower. The aircon at night isn't very consistent though, it can either too warm or too cold even though the thermostat has not been changed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 3 nights in The Oriental Suite in August, this is our third time at the MO. The suite is superb. Lovely separate entry foyer, the living room looked across the gorgeous HK Harbour, included a desk area with every accessory, gorgeous sumptuous seating, and beautifully decorated. The bedroom also has a TV. Walk in robe and separate robe storage in another area. Plenty of storage for clothes (we don't travel light), shoes, accessories, and luggage. The bathroom is out of this world. It has two separate vanities complete with every single toiletry you could possibly wish for or even think of. The toiletries are Aqua de Palma, in full sizes. They are replenished daily. Absolute luxury. Apparently Aqua de Palma only supply a very select number of hotels in the world despite being asked constantly. The shower has a rain shower on the ceiling and a double power shower head on the wall. Also a seat. TV in bathroom too. The toilet is in a frosted glass cubicle adjoining the bathroom and not too private, our only small dislike. The concierge is fantastic. Nothing is too much trouble. We organised a private driver to drive us around HK Island and take us to places not on the tourist route. We also visited Repulse Bay and had lunch at a gorgeous restaurant. A super day out of the busyness of HK. We used the spa and beauty shop which are both top of the line. The spa uses Gaylia Kristensen products which are the world's best as far as I'm concerned. The bar, on the top floor, has one of the very best views of the harbour and great drinks too. It would be great if this hotel had a club lounge, we really missed that feature. We had room service twice and couldn't fault it. The food was fabulous, hot and fresh and served with silver service. Highly recommended. One suite benefit was the option to have breakfast in either of the on site restaurant/cafes or room service. We chose the room service and it was superb. You could order whatever you wanted. It really felt luxurious. Again, it was served on time, hot and fresh. Gorgeous linen cloth and napkins, and silver cutlery and food covers. Transfers are in an S class Mercedes with superbly professional drivers. The MO is perfectly situated on HK Island surrounded by the very best malls which you can access via covered walkways. Another fabulous mini break in HK and would highly recommend the MO. Again, only gripe is no club lounge.
reviews.title: Traditional, exceptional, luxurious.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to be spoilt then this is the place to stay . We had 3 nights and would happily of stayed longer if we could . We had stayed in mongkok ( Langham hotel ) to experience Kowloon and now we were in Central and we were not disappointed . From the moment we arrived we were spoilt . We were given an upgrade ( due to it being the end of our honeymoon ) and we had a wonderful room overlooking the harbour . All the rooms have been renovated and they have done a wonderful job . They have a little " nook " with a lovely large chair so my wife would watch the world go by while reading and she just loved it . The room has everything and you get spoilt each night with different oils to rub into feet, back etc ..just amazing . They even gave us a large bottle of champagne as it was our honeymooon ..need i say more ...Each morning we went down to the mezinine level and got pastries and coffee from the shop .....well if u ever find better pastries in the world ..please let me know!! you will find cheaper ones for sure as it is very expensive , but when you are in 5 star luxury land you are not going to find anything cheap . We used the bar on the top floor one night which was great and also visited the captains bar which was excellent . The service is fantastic and i think the only fault i can find with the hotel is having to pay 15usd per day for internet ., Surely when you are paying 500 bucks per night you could include internet . All in all an amazing hotel , great service and in a great local in Central . If you want to spoil someone special or simply spoil yourself ..this is the place to stay .
reviews.title: Pure Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in HK and stayed at Mandarin Oriental. It really sets the standard for service.
reviews.title: Exceptionl Service and Hotel

reviews.text: Our room was on the 22 floor over looking the water. It was a magnificient view. The location is great, easily accessible from the airport via train and its location also allows you to walk about or catch the metro as easily.
reviews.title: White glove service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is very well trained, helpful and friendly. Our room was spotless and tastefully done. One word describes the hotel and its service - Outstanding!!!
reviews.title: My First Time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in a harbour view room for 2 nights in December. The view was not brilliant to be honest as I was only on the 4th floor, so its not really worth paying extra if you are going to be on one of the lower floors.
reviews.title: Will be coming here again

likes.disliked: — Harbour view not so great if you are on a lower floor

reviews.text: The room was very spacious, we had a single sofa, a desk with office chair, very big bed and the bath tub is a good size also. Very very clean also.
reviews.title: Faultless
Lovely Spa
reviews.text: The day that I got there, I urgently need to go out for a scheduled dinner and had to iron my shirt. I ended up phoning the reception for an iron and ironing board about 6 times before finally getting it after 45 minutes. So things were not great the first night.

Anyway, the next morning I decided to use their pool. Excellent service around the pool area, you get handed a bottle of water and a towel upon arrival. The pool and pool area is heated which is obviously a good touch. When you leave you get offered some fruit as well.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay @ Mandarin Oriental

likes.liked: — Location (5 minutes to Central MTR), service quality & location to central business district

reviews.text: The cleaners are brilliant, they fold all your clothes for you and tidy the whole room whilst you are out, as well as giving you new alot of new towels and shower gel,etc.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Hong Kong

reviews.text: Floor to ceiling windows overlooking the famous Hong Kong skyline. Huge comfortable bed and minimal outside noise despite being in heart of Central, connected to the shopping malls and near the Battery Path. Large 'wet room' style shower room with separate lavatory closet. High quality toiletries. All mod cons including international adapters, internet, TV, phones, electronic 'do not disturb' signs, private housekeeping two-way cupboard. A range of teas. Impeccable service. Everything perfectly arranged, new, clean, luxurious.
reviews.title: Arguably the best standard hotel room in the world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arguably, this is the best standard hotel room in the world.
reviews.title: Stunning,but some flaws

reviews.text: The Mandarin Grill restaurant is really, really good too -- and the breakfast buffet is a true feast.
reviews.title: Five Stars is Not Enough

reviews.text: All in all, truly a world class hotel in a world class city -- absolutely outstanding.
reviews.title: The best in Hong Kong

reviews.text: Stunning rooms, a room that just kept on giving.Wonderful housekeeping,room amenities,food and room service excellent.Though sadly a few flaws soured a bit of the stay.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is of the highest standard of all! Excellency to all details.
reviews.title: Super!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Hong Kong on several occasions, and I must say that this is one of the finest hotels in the world, and I would recommend to anyone looking for a luxury hotel in Hong Kong.
reviews.title: 5 stars all the way around

reviews.text: In addition to an amazingly helpful staff and about the best location you can find in Hong Kong (Central, right near lots of great shopping, restaurants and bars), the Mandarin Oriental has some of the nicest and most well-designed rooms around.
reviews.title: Elegance

reviews.text: Their Harbour Rooms offer extreme comfort and class, but if you have the choice, I'd recommend throwing down a little extra cash for a Deluxe Suite, which has a separate bedroom, extra large tub overlooking the Bank of China building, and comfortable living room with a work station and sofa.
reviews.title: phe.nomenal

reviews.text: Breakfasts at the Clipper Lounge and Cafe Causette are both delicious (I recommend the corn beef hash skillet at Causette), and M Bar makes superlative Manhattans and gin & tonics.
reviews.title: Oh joy!

reviews.text: We have stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Hong Kong numerous times over many years, and it is always the first choice hotel for business and leisure. The service is excellent from the moment we step off the plane with a golf cart ready to avoid the long airport walk, and an attendent to guide us through immigration to the waiting car, the friendly doormen, the knowledgeable concierge service (who patiently answer all our requests and print maps to everywhere), room service and waitresses. There are not a lot of children at this hotel and the staff are very friendly to ours.
reviews.title: A traditional hotel in the heart of Central.
Amazing Place to Get a Sund Sleep after a long day of work
reviews.text: It is a traditional Hong Kong hotel- a little bit fussy but with nice touches.. the silver service for breakfast and room service, the little niceties when the beds are turned down, chocolates and gifts for the children. There is a wide variety of restaurants and food available- buffet breakfast is civilised with dim sum, omelettes, porridge etc.., The location is prime- taxis readily available, the MTR right next door and shopping right on the doorstep.
This is an expensive place to stay but well worth it for luxury, location and service.
reviews.title: They make the little things count

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: great location, amazing service, luxury, amazing beds..love the showers...they really do pamper you..feels good to be back after a long day of work in the lap of comfort and love to be pampered
reviews.title: The best hotel in Asia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was so excited each night to get back to my room to see what the turndown staff had left on my bed. The pillow atomiser (spray) was a lovely touch my favourite was the gel eye pads. The staff the atmosphere and look of the Hotel all exceeded my expectations.
reviews.title: Literally the best hotel i ever stayed at

description: Renowned 25-story hotel overlooking Victoria Harbour - Heart of business and financial district - Most rooms with balconies
